meanings.definition: A document written entirely by the person whose signature it bears.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer confirmed the authenticity of the holographs in the will.
meanings.sent2: Please sign the holographs at the bottom of the page.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the dog's paw print on the homework made it a holographs assignment.
meanings.sent4: Her handwritten letter was a holographs of her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll contained valuable holographs from a famous philosopher.

meanings.definition: A three-dimensional image formed by the interference of light beams from a laser or other coherent light source.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed stunning holographs of historical figures.
meanings.sent2: He was amazed by the holographs of planets in the science exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to touch the holographs, thinking they were real.
meanings.sent4: The holographs of the city skyline seemed to come alive in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The holographs of the butterfly fluttered with vibrant colors.
